data.title: Blake Buchanan
data.text:
2023-24

• All-ACC Academic Team

• ACC Honor Roll

• Played 34 games, including six starts

• Averaged 3.4 points and 3.1 rebounds

• Shot 41.4 percent from the field and 50 percent from the free throw line

• Tallied 18 points (10 of 16 FT) and seven rebounds vs. Florida (11/10/23)

• Collected nine points, six rebounds and two steals vs. NCCU (12/5/23)

• Registered eight points (4-5 FG) and three rebounds vs. Virginia Tech (1/17/24)

• Recorded six points and three rebounds in first career start vs. North Carolina A&T (11/14/23)

• Tallied six points and five rebounds vs. Louisville (1/3/24)

• Collected six points, two rebounds, two blocked shots and one steal vs. Miami (2/5/24)

• Registered six points, seven rebounds and two blocked shots vs. Wake Forest (2/17/24)

• Chipped in five points, two rebounds and two blocked shots at Boston College (2/28/24)

• Scored four points and had five rebounds in start at NC State (1/6/24)

• Netted four points along with eight rebounds vs. NC State (1/24/24)

• Tallied four points and five rebounds at Florida State (2/10/24)

• Contributed four points, five rebounds and two steals at Louisville (1/27/24)

• Grabbed four rebounds in collegiate debut vs. Tarleton State (11/6/23)

• Blocked three shots vs. Texas Southern (11/16/23)

• Lettered

HIGH SCHOOL

• Four-year basketball letterwinner at Lake City High School in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho

• Graduated from Lake City High School in 2023

• Averaged 15.2 points, 9.8 rebounds, 1.9 steals, 1.9 blocks and 3 assists per game in leading Lake City to the Idaho 5A state championship with a 26-0 record

• Tallied 26 points and 11 rebounds in Lake City’s 75-61 victory over Meridian in the championship game

• Named Idaho Mr. Basketball, Gatorade Player of the Year and MaxPreps Player of the Year

• Earned Idaho 5A All-state first-team honors and All-conference honors as a senior

• Averaged 13 points and eight rebounds as a junior in 2021-22

• Named First Team All-State, First Team All-League and North Idaho Player of the Year after leading Lake City to a 23-3 record

• Earned Defensive MVP honors at the 2022 Idaho state tournament

• Named First-Team All-State and First-Team All-State Tournament as a sophomore in 2020-21

• Received All-State Tournament second-team honors as a freshman

• Participated in the 2023 Nike Hoop Summit, collecting eight points, eight rebounds and one steal in Team USA’s 90-84 win over the International team

• Invited to the USA Basketball U19 Men’s National Team training camp
